title: American_Top_40_November_4th,_1972
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

Chuck Berry is at #3 with "My Ding-A-Ling." Back in 1972, some stations refused to play the song on AT40, even when it reached number one.
One song in the countdown comes from an album that was rejected by 12 record companies in a row.
Casey answers the question, "Was there ever a year female recording acts had more number one hits than male recording acts."
If you don't know what a "flying saucer" type record is, there is one in this countdown.
Casey answers the question, "Has there ever been a year when foreign recording acts had more number one's than American recording acts."
